newsitem.title: CHINA: PRESS DIGEST - Chinese newspapers - Dec 13.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Chinese newspapers - Dec 13.

text.p: Following is a summary of major Chinese political and business stories in leading newspapers, prepared by Reuters in Beijing. Reuters has not checked the stories and does not guarantee their accuracy. Telephone: (8610) 6532-1921. Fax: (8610) 6532-4978.
Vice-minister of Culture Li Yuanchao says China must resist the import of decadent culture and guard against developed nations who ship their values to developing countries.
President Jiang Zemin, in a speech on the 60th anniversary of the Xian Incident, urges people to unite and focus on the rejuvenation, reunification and modernisation of the country.
Wu Wenying, chairman of the China General Association of Textile Industry, urges continued reductions in textile output.
Qiao Shi, head of the National People's Congress, hails the normalisation of relations between China and South Africa, saying it is in the fundamental interests of the two countries.
